title: Dan Lawrie sculpting global setting at Burlington’s Royal Botanical Gardens
text:
A A The Donor: Dan Lawrie
The Gift: $1.1-million
The Causes: Art Gallery of Burlington and Royal Botanical Gardens
When Dan Lawrie was growing up in Winnipeg, his parents took him to see the Leo Mol Sculpture Garden in Assiniboine Park. The visit left a lasting impression and Mr. Lawrie began a life-long fascination with sculptures.
“It somehow resonated with me,” said Mr. Lawrie, who runs an insurance business in Burlington, Ont. “I somehow fell in love with sculptures.”
His passion has sent Mr. Lawrie around the world, visiting museums and meeting sculptors to learn more about their craft. He has also become a major donor, contributing $1-million to the Royal Botanical Gardens in Burlington for the creation of an international sculpture garden and $100,000 to the Art Gallery of Burlington, along with a sculpture for the gallery’s main courtyard.
“I just have a soft spot for the gallery,” Mr. Lawrie said about his recent gifts. “I want it to grow and be an intricate part of the community.”
Mr. Lawrie said he is still intrigued by sculptures and the artists who create them. “There’s always a story behind a sculpture,” he said.
